results.title: Potential mechanisms of stroke benefit favoring losartan in the Losartan Intervention For Endpoint reduction in hypertension (LIFE) study.
results.text_hl: Thus, the observed outcomes benefits favoring @CHEMICAL_Losartan @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019808 @@@losartan@@@ may involve other possible mechanisms, including differential effects of @CHEMICAL_Losartan @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019808 @@@losartan@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ on @DISEASE_Hypertrophy_Left_Ventricular @DISEASE_MESH:D017379 @@@LVH@@@ regression, left atrial diameter, @DISEASE_Atrial_Fibrillation @DISEASE_MESH:D001281 @@@atrial fibrillation@@@, brain natriuretic peptide, vascular structure, @<m>DISEASE_Thrombosis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D013927 @@@thrombus@@@ formation/@DISEASE_Blood_Platelet_Disorders @DISEASE_MESH:D001791 @@@platelet aggregation@@@, serum @CHEMICAL_Uric_Acid @CHEMICAL_MESH:D014527 @@@uric acid@@@, @DISEASE_Albuminuria @DISEASE_MESH:D000419 @@@albuminuria@@@, new-onset @DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus @DISEASE_MESH:D003920 @@@diabetes@@@, and @CHEMICAL_Lipids @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008055 @@@lipid@@@ metabolism.

citations.NLM: Devereux RB, Dahlöf B. Potential mechanisms of stroke benefit favoring losartan in the Losartan Intervention For Endpoint reduction in hypertension (LIFE) study. Curr Med Res Opin. 2007 Feb;23(2):443-57. PMID: 17288698
citations.BibTeX: @article{17288698, title={Potential mechanisms of stroke benefit favoring losartan in the Losartan Intervention For Endpoint reduction in hypertension (LIFE) study.}, author={Devereux RB and Dahlöf B}, journal={Curr Med Res Opin}, volume={23}, number={2}, pages={443-57}}

results.title: Platelet function and antithrombin, plasminogen, and fibrinolytic activities in cats with heart disease.
results.text_hl: Platelets from @SPECIES_9685 @@@cats@@@ receiving @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ had decreased responsiveness to @CHEMICAL_Adenosine_Diphosphate @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000244 @@@adenosine diphosphate@@@ and unaltered responsiveness to collagen, compared with platelets from healthy @SPECIES_9685 @@@cats@@@, and may have decreased risk of @<m>DISEASE_Thrombosis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D013927 @@@thrombus@@@ formation.

citations.NLM: Welles EG, Boudreaux MK, Crager CS, Tyler JW. Platelet function and antithrombin, plasminogen, and fibrinolytic activities in cats with heart disease. Am J Vet Res. 1994 May;55(5):619-27. PMID: 8067608
citations.BibTeX: @article{8067608, title={Platelet function and antithrombin, plasminogen, and fibrinolytic activities in cats with heart disease.}, author={Welles EG and Boudreaux MK and Crager CS and Tyler JW}, journal={Am J Vet Res}, volume={55}, number={5}, pages={619-27}}

results.title: [Endo arterial investigation: suspicious for the cholesterol crystal embolism disease].
results.text_hl: This @DISEASE_Aneurysm @DISEASE_MESH:D000783 @@@aneurysm@@@ contains a marginal surrounding @<m>DISEASE_Thrombosis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D013927 @@@thrombosis@@@ with high embolic risk.

citations.NLM: Fehri W, Lahidheb D, Bouladi W, Rahal N, Smiri Z, Barakett N, Hajlaoui N, Salah O, Mhenni H, Haouala H. [Endo arterial investigation: suspicious for the cholesterol crystal embolism disease]. Tunis Med. 2007 Nov;85(11):975-8. PMID: 19166153
